    removeUnreachable()

      Parameters:

      Throws:
      IOException - on error reading the file

  • Method Details

    • removeUnproductiveSymbols

      public void removeUnproductiveSymbols()
      Removes unproductive symbols from the grammar. The algorithm will iterate through every rule and : - In the first iteration, it will transfer the rules with terminals only to the new grammar and remove them from the old one - From the second iteration onwards, it will transfer the rules with terminals and/or terminal variables contained in the new grammar from iteration 1 and remove them from the old one. - The algorithm will proceed until no rules have been added to the new clean grammar.

    • getProductiveRules

      private boolean getProductiveRules(HashMap<String,List<Rule>> newGrammar, ArrayList<Object[]> removedRules)
      Scans the grammar and transfers the productive rules to newGrammar
      Parameters:
      newGrammar - The new clean grammar to replace the old dirty one
      removedRules - Array of rules to be removed from the old grammar
      Returns:
      True if no productive rules have been found, false otherwise

    • removeUnreachable

      public void removeUnreachable()
      Removes unreachable rules from the starting one - Starting from the start state, scan its rules and add the variables to a queue if not contained in reachableSymbols to avoid endless loops in recursive grammars - For every variable in the queue, scan its rules and do the same as in the previous steps - The algorithm will stop when no variables are found in the queue - Finally, get the intersection between variableOrd and reachable rules. What is left in variableOrd is the reachable rules while maintaining their order

    • getFollow

      private Set<Terminal> getFollow(String currentVar, String inVar, String rule)
      Compute Follow1(currentVar)
      Parameters:
      currentVar - The variable for which to compute the Follow1 set
      inVar - The variable of the rule we're looking at
      rule - The rule to search currentVar occurrences in with LHS = inVar
      Returns:
      The Follow1(currentVar) set

    • getFirstsFollowing

      private Set<Terminal> getFirstsFollowing(String inVar, String rule, int k)
      Helper method to getFollow. Iterate through a rule string computing each token's First1 set until no epsilon is returned or end of string is reached
      Parameters:
      inVar - Variable producing the rule to search in
      rule - The rule string
      k - Starting index to iterate though
      Returns:
      The combined First1 sets (if epsilons are found) of the tokens in the rule starting from index k
